title: Ortege Studio
text:
Ortege Studio can be located at https://app.ortege.xyz
Currently it is a closed beta. If you‚Äôd like to gain access please email christos@ortege.io

title: Quick Start
text:
One of our goals at Ortege is to abstract away as much complexity as possible from our users. As such we would prefer users asking our chat agents most queries to ensure they‚Äôre getting highly focused answers saving our users time.
However we still need to generate the content in order for our chat agent‚Äôs to be able to be up to date with the latest information on the Ortege data platform.
So all our documentation will be available through this site. However we‚Äôd encourage you to rather use OrtegeGPT for a better experience in finding the information you require.
Else our documentation is divided into: * Ortege Studio * Data Topology * Research articles
This documentation is open source and community generated. Please submit a PR if you see anything wrong.
Our documentation is written in Quarto and will be stored in a Milvus vector database which will periodically update our early stage chat bots.

title: Ortege Lakehouse
text:
We host our lakehouse on Azure Storage. So we do incur costs for it. We want to make our Lakehouse available to all, and at present is currently available through Ortege Studio.
Please read our Data Ontology in order to acquaint yourself with how the data is structured throughout all Ortege products.

title: Data Topology
text:
If you‚Äôre looking to be heavily involved in Ortege, then this will be one of the most important areas to understand.
Our data is deployed as Delta Lake tables and adhere to the following naming conventions.

title: Data Topology
text:
Blockchains
TODO Add some data here explaining the different classifications of Blockchains. Link to some Jon Charbaneu stuff.

title: Data Topology
text:
Account Types
An important distinction between blockchains is their ledger model. This indicates how the underlying blockchain ledger records information about token transfers and balances. The two major classifcations are: * UTXO * Accounts based model

title: Contributing a Research article
text:
Inserting data from Ortege Lakehouse
The great thing about Quarto is that you can embed code. That means you‚Äôll be able to embed code directly into your Ortege Researh article and when the article gets accepted, the code will be executed and the results of the code displayed in your research article.
Let‚Äôs unpack that by adding a bar char of Bitcoin Hash power over the past month.


Missing Datasets
If your research report needs data that isn‚Äôt in our lakehouse, you have a few options in order to get the data into our lakehouse. 1. Send us the Parquet files of the dataset 2. Create a pipeline by submitting a PR to Ortege‚Äôs open source ETL codebase 3. Reach out to the team to discuss a joint effort

title: Contributing a Research article
text:
Contributing a research article through Ortege is a great way for budding crypto research analysts and more general data analysts to showcase their skills to the broader community and gain some exposure.
In this article, we‚Äôll walk you through how simple it is to create a research article. We‚Äôll walk through an example of creating a Bitcoin research article.
First navigate to articles folder in this repository and make a copy of the template.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text: Ortege excels in delivering unparalleled insights into blockchain ecosystems. Our tools empower you to unlock more possibilities, completely free of charge.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text:
üî• Ortege Studio
Ortege Studio allows you to dive into blockchain data analysis, craft engaging visualizations, and share your findings through interactive dashboards.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text:
üåê OrtegeGPT
Explore the future of AI-assisted data analysis with OrtegeGPT. This revolutionary chatbot provides insights into both on-chain and off-chain data, leveraging advanced AI for quick, accurate answers and analytics.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text:
Ortege Research
Delve into the world of crypto with our comprehensive Ortege Research articles. Freely accessible to all, we cover more chains and dApps than any other competitor.

title: Welcome to Ortege
text:
üåü Ortege Lakehouse
Introducing Ortege Lakehouse - our open data lakehouse. Accessible to everyone, it allows for both accessing and contributing data.

title: OrtegeGPT
text:
OrtegeGPT is the primary way we‚Äôd like our users to discover Ortege. All our documentation in this site is deployed into our own Large Language Model, or LLM. We then deploy this as a chat agent that our users can utilise in order to discover Ortege and it‚Äôs suite of products.
Our first chat agent is called Asimov and is in active development at the moment.
While he is not deployed at present, he should be up and running in the next few weeks and deployed via Hugging Face Spaces.

title: Research Articles
text:
The Research reports will be updated daily with fresh data. This means we provide what internally we call, realtime Research articles. We grew frustrated with the high cost of solutions such as Messari and their point in time reports. We believe there is a better way to serve the crypto community: * Open access to market research * Presented in a visual style that encourages data storytelling * Research reports that update with live data

Current Reports

State of Bitcoin



Technologies used
We use Streamlit in order to host our charts and visualizations.


Contributing
Anyone can release a research article and submit a PR in our Github. If the research article is accepted, it will deployed to our production documentation site and we will promote your article on our socials.
Please see the contributing guide to learn more about how to submit your own research report.
